intro: Ictinus piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Ictinus piloselloides is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
